title: Chelsea midfielder Cesc Fabregas refuses to rule out Chinese Super League switch as he eyes American future
text:
Sport Chelsea midfielder Cesc Fabregas refuses to rule out Chinese Super League switch as he eyes American future The Spaniard has already planned for his future post-Chelsea, while he is also preparing to take his coaching badges Share Fabregas has opened up on his future (Photo: Darren Walsh) Share Get Chelsea FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Chelsea midfielder Cesc Fabregas has refused to move out a future move to China. 
The Spanish midfielder, 29, has been part of the Blues run to the top of the Premier League table, but has largely found himself playing second fiddle to N’Golo Kante and Nemanja Matic at the heart of Antonio Conte’s midfield. 
The ex-Barcelona and Arsenal star saw teammate Oscar swap Stamford Bridge for the Chinese Super League during January, while Diego Costa has also been linked with a move to the Far East. 
And while Fabregas already has a plan for his post-Premier League future, he has left the door open on a switch to the CSL. Fabregas comes up against old side Arsenal on Saturday (Photo: Darren Walsh) 
"Once I retire from Europe, you never know,” declared Fabregas, speaking to Natacha Tannous in a YouTube interview when asked about playing in China. 
"My plan, once I don't think I can play in Europe, my plan at the moment is to go to the [United] States. 
"But you never know." Fabregas has largely played second fiddle to Antonio Conte (Photo: 2017 Getty Images) Read More Arsene Wenger may be forced to sit with Chelsea fans 
Fabregas also opened up on life after playing, and says he is interested in a potential move into coaching. 
"If you ask me now, yes, I think in my mind I have plans of taking the badges and studying for it and it's something that motivates me for the future. 
"But at the same time I'm still very young and I hope I still have many more years of playing. But I can see myself in the future as a trainer yes."
